discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Views cannot be share, only the Secure Views, hence, A is not correct. External Stages cannot be shared, but the External tables, yes. In addition, it was brought in the list, Dynamic Tables and Apache Iceberg Tables. Hence, the answer would be External Tables and Dynamic Tables. Also, a big surprise is Database...

Selected Answer: DE
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-sharing-intro
Secure Data Sharing lets you share selected objects in a database in your account with other Snowflake accounts. You can share the following Snowflake objects:

Databases

Tables

Dynamic tables

External tables

Apache Iceberg™ tables

Secure views

Secure materialized views

Secure user-defined functions (UDFs)

Models without code (such as CORTEX_FINETUNED)

comments.content: Please, recheck. External Stages are not there.

questions.question_text: Which database objects can be shared with Secure Data Sharing? (Choose two.)
When a transient table in Snowflake is dropped, what happens to the table?

choices.A: The table is no longer available for use.
choices.D: The table can be recovered only with the assistance of Snowflake Support.
choices.B: The table can be undropped using Fail-safe.
choices.C: The table can be recovered for 1 day only and after that it is no longer available.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Snowflake didn't provide explicit information about the impact of dropping the transient table, but I have found this: https://hevodata.com/learn/what-is-snowflake-transient-table/.
"For instance, if a system failure occurs and a Transitory Table is dropped or lost, the data is no longer accessible by you or Snowflake after one day. As a result, it’s advisable to use Snowflake Transient Table only for data that does not require failure protection or can be recreated outside of Snowflake."
Hence, after max 1 day, the data will be lost.

Selected Answer: C
Time Travel for Temporary and Transient tables is 0 or 1. Hence, even if the tables itself is no longer available for being used, it is possible to use it for 1 more day, if the Time Travel was set to 1. Hence, I vote C.

Selected Answer: D
Listings are specifically designed to handle the complexities of sharing data across different regions and cloud platforms. They utilize Snowflake's data replication feature to automatically replicate data to the consumer's region.

questions.question_text:
A data provider needs to securely collaborate with data consumers who do not reside in the same region.

What Snowflake sharing mechanism should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
csv is default format

questions.question_text: What is the default File Format used in the COPY command if one is not specified?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
First of all, Compute does not exist. Second, the way the question is addressed can take us to the thought of Metadata Cache. Metadata Cache, stores statistics and Metadata about Objects, such as Max/Min values for a column. Hence, I reply C. Metadata Cache is stored on Cloud Services, based on what I found in the courses.
